dialogs.line: You’ve made it far without armor, and somehow in one piece. Ahead lies a slumbering dragon in its cave, guarding riches and glory.
And above is the tower, where knights gather in trust and unity. Without armor, you’ll reach the top with ease.
But that dragon won’t fall to words or trust. You’ll need armor to survive its claws and flames.
Armor may protect you, but it also weighs you down. The tower is your chance to embrace vulnerability and connection.

dialogs.question: Will you take armor for the dragon or climb the tower without it?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll take the armor, slay the dragon, and claim its treasure.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll climb the tower and trust in the knights above.

dialogs.line: Smart choice. This armor will keep you safe. Now go forth and slay the dragon to claim its riches!
Your story will be one of glory and triumph! You’ll be a hero to all and be accepted once again!
I hope the armor serves you well, though I wish you’d chosen connection over defense.
Thank you for your continued trust! Please climb the tower and us knights will show you the strength of trust and unity!
Bah! Trust won’t make you a true hero, I hope you don't plan to return to that old town.
With one layer of armor, you’re protected, but is it enough? Ahead lies a slumbering dragon in its cave, guarding riches and glory.
I hope the knight's tower can also call to you. To climb, you’ll need to shed your defenses and trust in us knights as we await at the top.
Bah! Riches and glory are in the cave. Why risk it all for connection when treasure is so close?

dialogs.question: Will you take more armor for the dragon or shed your armor to climb the tower?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll take more armor. I need all the protection I can get.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll shed this armor. I’m ready to climb the tower and join the knight community.
dialogs.answer2: I’ll keep what I have as I take on the dragon.

dialogs.line: Smart choice. This armor will keep you safe. Now go forth and slay the dragon to claim its riches!
Your story will be one of glory and triumph! You’ll be a hero to all and be accepted once again!
I hope the armor serves you well, though I wish you’d chosen connection over defense.
Thank you! You’ve made the right choice. Connection lies at the top of the tower, not behind walls of steel.
Bah! We’ll see how well trust serves you when danger strikes.
I fail to understand why you decline further protection...
Alas, glory awaits! I pray that your current armor will carry you to victory.
Be careful. Glory may not be as fulfilling as you think.
Ahead lies a slumbering dragon in its cave, guarding riches and glory. Slay this dragon and your old town will love you!
As knights we still want ask to climb our tower and join our community, but you must let go of the weight holding you back.
With two layers of armor, the dragon doesn’t stand a chance. But the climb? You’ll never make it like this.

dialogs.question: What will you do? Keep your armor, shed it for the climb, or take a third layer?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll keep my armor. The dragon is my goal.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll shed my armor. I want to climb the tower.
dialogs.answer2: I’ll take more armor. I want to be unstoppable.
